etymology.description: 二(二) (èr, "two; second") + 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 车(車) (chē, "vehicle") = a vehicle that has passed through second hands -> used car
etymology.interpretation: The term 二手车(二手車) (èr shǒu chē) effectively describes a 'used car' by combining the idea of second-hand ownership with a vehicle. This is a straightforward way in Mandarin to refer to items that are pre-owned or have been previously used by someone else.

examples.chinese: 我昨天买了一辆二手车(我昨天買了一輛二手車)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuótiān mǎile yī liàng èr shǒu chē.
examples.english: I bought a used car yesterday.

examples.chinese: 他决定修理那辆二手车(他決定修理那輛二手車)，希望它能跑得更快(希望它能跑得更快)。
examples.pinyin: Tā juédìng xiūlǐ nà liàng èr shǒu chē, xīwàng tā néng pǎo de gèng kuài.
examples.english: He decided to repair that used car, hoping it could run faster.
